overview_summary: None of the four profiled neighbors has made a public statement supporting or opposing the Linkwood area development, so all are currently classified with unknown stances. Their community influence appears limited, as none hold public office or prominent leadership roles locally. Most are private landowners with minimal public profiles, indicating that any concerns or opposition they might have would likely remain low-profile and individual.

neighbors.name: Mendiola Meliton Alberto Garcia
neighbors.claims: Meliton Alberto Garcia is listed as an owner of a parcel on Linkwood Road near the Linkwood community in Dorchester County [Dorchester Chamber of Commerce](https://www.dorchesterchamber.org/news/details/public-notice-from-rwe-clean-energy). No evidence of Garcia’s involvement in local civic affairs or any public stance on development was found; the only references to his name were outside Maryland (e.g., a South Carolina report) [Patch (Summerville, SC)](https://patch.com/south-carolina/summerville/busted-arrest-reports-for-dec-23).

approach_recommendations.engage: As an absent or low-profile landowner, initial outreach via a polite formal letter or phone call—sharing project details and inviting questions—may help build trust and gauge his interest.

neighbors.name: Sean P. Reincke and Susan K. Reincke
neighbors.claims: Sean P. Reincke is a teacher at Cambridge-South Dorchester High School, indicating he is an active local community member [Cambridge-South Dorchester HS Staff Directory](https://www.dcps.k12.md.us/o/cambridgesouth/staff?page_no=4). Neither Sean nor Susan Reincke holds a public office or has been noted speaking on development issues in any local records or media [Maryland Manual – Dorchester County](https://2022mdmanual.msa.maryland.gov/).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Reinckes through a friendly, personal approach (e.g., at a community event or via a neighborly visit) and emphasize transparency and facts; as an educator, Sean may appreciate open dialogue about the project.

neighbors.name: Doretha O. Abraham
neighbors.claims: Doretha O. Abraham is a long-time local landowner; property records also list her as Doretha Dockins Abraham, reflecting a family name with deep roots in Dorchester County [Free Dorchester Obituary Index](http://dcgm.tripod.com/dcgmcdindex.html#99). She has no recorded participation in public meetings or committees and has not taken any documented stance on development or energy projects [Maryland Manual – Dorchester County](https://2022mdmanual.msa.maryland.gov/).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach Mrs. Abraham with respect for her long family tenure in the area. A personal visit by a community liaison emphasizing the project’s respect for local land and heritage may address any legacy or land-preservation concerns she could have.

neighbors.name: Mary Elizabeth Scott et al
neighbors.claims: Mary Elizabeth Scott (with “et al” indicating other family co-owners) holds an ownership stake in land in the Linkwood vicinity of Dorchester County [Dorchester Chamber of Commerce](https://www.dorchesterchamber.org/news/details/public-notice-from-rwe-clean-energy). She does not serve in any public leadership capacity, and there are no public statements from her regarding local development in available records [Maryland Manual – Dorchester County](https://2022mdmanual.msa.maryland.gov/).

approach_recommendations.engage: Use a neighborly, informal approach—perhaps through an introduction by a mutual acquaintance or local community meeting—to share information about the project. Emphasize community benefits and listen to any family concerns to build goodwill.
